org.apache.james.mailbox.jcr

Class AbstractJCRScalingMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.james.mailbox.store.transaction.TransactionalMapper
      • org.apache.james.mailbox.jcr.AbstractJCRScalingMapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JCRImapConstants, Mapper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JCRMailboxMapper, JCRSubscriptionMapper

    public abstract class AbstractJCRScalingMapper
extends TransactionalMapper
implements JCRImapConstants
    Abstract base class for Mapper's which support scaling. This supports Level 1 Implementations of JCR. So no real transaction management is used. The Session.save() will get called on commit() method, session.refresh(false) on rollback, and session.refresh(true) on begin()

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.apache.james.mailbox.store.transaction.Mapper

        Mapper.Transaction<T>, Mapper.VoidTransaction

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void begin()
      Begin is not supported by level 1 JCR implementations, however we refresh the session
      protected void commit()
      Just call save on the underlying JCR Session, because level 1 JCR implementation does not offer Transactions

      Construct the user node path part, using the specified scaling factor.

      void endRequest()
      Logout from open JCR Session
      protected org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()
      Return the logger
      protected javax.jcr.Session getSession()
      Return the JCR Session
      protected void rollback()
      Rollback is not supported by level 1 JCR implementations, so just do nothing

      • constructUserPathPart

        protected String constructUserPathPart(String username)
        Construct the user node path part, using the specified scaling factor. If the username is not long enough it will fill it with PAD So if you use a scaling of 2 it will look like: foo: f/fo/foo fo: f/fo/fo f: f/f_/f
        Parameters:
        username -
        Returns:
        path

      • createUserPathStructure

        protected javax.jcr.Node createUserPathStructure(javax.jcr.Node parent,
                                     String username)
                                          throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Create the needed Node structure for the given username using the given Node as parent. The method will use constructUserPathPart(String) for create the needed node path and split it when a NODE_DELIMITER was found
        Parameters:
        parent -
        username -
        Returns:
        userNode
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException
